value.0:
OOC instructions for the DM:

1. Have the player summon the creature he/she wishes to re-skin. Use the widget on this summon. The name changes to Summon Changer: Initialised.

2. The Widget has two modes, basic which copies Portait, name (if its not a familar companion) and tail. Use the widget on the widget to set it to advanced which copies  Appearance, Bodyparts, hair/skin/tattooe colors, tails, wings, portait, name and description.

3. Create the creature who's appearance template you wish to use. The name changes to Summon Changer: Attuned. The item description will change to reflect on which summon the widget holds. 

4. Give the widget to the player. The summon it was attuned to will change on spawning. Familiars/Animal Companions will keep their name and continue changing when the character gains a level. Summons can change when they are upgraded when the character gains a level. They get the name of new appearance. All types get the new appearance's portrait.

Optional step: Adding the integer summon_vfx will apply a permanent duration visual to the summon. This can be used for things such as applying an iceskin to a snowy summon, or a shadowshield visual to a Shadowdancer summon. This can be done anytime before the widget is handed over to the player!
